ArticleTitle.sentence: Cloning of ARE-containing genes by AU-motif-directed display.

AbstractText.sentence: A procedure suitable for cloning labile mRNAs that contain AU motifs is presented (AU-DD).
These motifs are regulatory sequences within the so-called AU-rich elements (AREs) often found in 3' untranslated regions of genes such as cytokines, proto-oncogenes, and transcription factors.
AU-DD is an AU-motif-directed differential display that permits the identification of ARE-containing genes differentially expressed after cell activation.

event.clue: AU-DD is an AU-motif-directed differential display that permits the identification of ARE-containing genes differentially expressed after cell activation.
AU-DD is an AU-motif-directed differential display that permits the identification of ARE-containing genes differentially expressed after cell activation.

AbstractText.sentence: It has been applied to peripheral blood monocytes and a T cell clone to isolate 59 cDNA fragments associated to activation.

AbstractText.sentence: Fourteen percent of isolated fragments belong to already known genes that certainly are cytokines and transduction/transcription factors.
The remaining 86% correspond to unknown genes of which 92% have been confirmed to be differentially expressed.

AbstractText.sentence: These data demonstrate the efficiency of the system and support the notion that numerous genes falling into those categories remain unidentified and that they can be cloned by this method.
